comments:
The following exception is thrown when user try to relaunch an application.

- Start RAC
- Launch StartStop
- Detach from agent
- Attach to Agent via 'Attach Java process' launch configuration
- Finish StartStop
- Open profile launch dialog, select Monitor tab of existing launch config and try relaunch. Both TI and PI collector is shown due to connection timeout (error shown in console).
- Try selecting TI collector and analysis type to launch results in error.

org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.exceptions.TimeoutException: Launching Process command timed out.
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.AgentController.queryAvailableAgents(AgentController.java:997)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.AgentController.queryAvailableAgents(AgentController.java:1041)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.util.internal.AgentControllerPool$1.run(AgentControllerPool.java:114)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:803)
Restarting WB (without restart RAC) can workaround the problem and profile can continue.

I'm also able to reproduce this defect consistently.  Restarting the workbench is of course not a sufficient workaround.  This should be a 4.2.0.2 candidate.  I'm pretty sure that the error is coming from the new execution framework (Guru would be a good candidate to investigate the defect).
Hi Igor. Can you take a look at this in 4.5? I am not familiar with this new code. Thanks.

(In reply to comment #3)
